worklogs.comment:
bkietz commented on pull request #4262: ARROW-3475: [C++] Allow builders to finish to the corresponding array type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4262
 
 
   Allows `Int64Builder` to finish into `shared_ptr<Int64Array>`, `ListBuilder` to finish into `shared_ptr<ListArray>`, etc.

bkietz commented on issue #4262: ARROW-3475: [C++] Allow builders to finish to the corresponding array type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4262#issuecomment-489734721
 
 
   Hmmm, I'm not sure how to resolve this [doc error](https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/528906138#L4849). Doxygen produces an extra declaration of `ArrayBuilder::Finish` from the [explicit `using`](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4262/files#diff-011119a62ed7b6dcdc29e9e46674ee94R123). Without the explicit `using`, the base class' overload for plain `Array` doesn't participate in overload resolution.
   
   I could rename the method to `FinishTyped` but that seems like a sloppy solution. Is there a doxygen tag/option I could use to explicitly ignore the declaration from `using`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

comments.body: Agreed. We have {{TypeTraits<T>::ArrayType}} so the implementation can delegate and {{std::static_pointer_cast}} (or similar)
